prompt:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
For API StringTokenizer.nextToken, the API usage rule is: Create a StringTokenizer with a specified string and delimiter, and then obtain the next token as long as there are more tokens available.

Question: Ignoring hyphens while using Scanner: :Is there any easy way to ignore hyphens while using scanner? I have a program that will allow you to buy an area (2D array) so if the user want to buy area 3-6, I want scanner to put the number before the hyphen in row and the number after in column. Is there any easy way to do this?String[][] buyer = new String[10][15];int row;int column; System.out.print("Specify which area you want to buy: ");row = scan.nextInt();column = scan.nextInt();String name;System.out.print("Name of the buyer: ");name = scan.nextLine();buyer[row][colum] = name
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);
String[][] buyer = new String[10][15];
int row;
int column;

System.out.print("Specify which area you want to buy: ");
String area = scan.nextLine();

StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(area, "-");
row = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
column = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());

String name;
System.out.print("Name of the buyer: ");
name = scan.nextLine();

buyer[row][column] = name;
<<<explanation>>>: 
To ignore hyphens while using Scanner, you can read the input as a string and then use StringTokenizer to split the string into two parts based on the hyphen. The first part will be the row number and the second part will be the column number. You can then convert these parts into integers using Integer.parseInt() and assign them to the row and column variables. Finally, you can read the name of the buyer using scan.nextLine() and assign it to the corresponding position in the buyer array.
